subject: Re: [junit] Platform dependent JUnit testcases
msgSnippet: ... How does your production code decide on which platform it runs? Can t the test just do the same? Robert
messageBody:
On Friday 20 February 2004 13:17, humbugzilla wrote:
> Java is write-once-run-anywhere - right? However, some of us need to
> test platform specific behaviour, for example, classes that only run
> in Windows or some other environment.

How does your production code decide on which platform it runs? Can't the
test just do the same?

Robert
